item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group offering insurance and wealth management solutions in the US, Canada, Europe, and Asia

We are on a transformational journey. We want to remove complexity from the financial services industry, to make people’s lives better by helping to make their decisions easier. Being part of this transformation is hugely exciting and offers talented, ambitious people an amazing opportunity to build a career. If that sounds like you, then we want to hear from you.

We are looking for a Data Science Engineer to join our Advanced Customer Analytics team. Your job will be to support initiatives that improve client experience and outcomes. Your primary responsibility will be researching and developing a global customer analytics record that will be used to identify insights and develop targeted, digital interventions. 

Who We Are
 

Manulife’s Advanced Customer Analytics team works across our global insurance and wealth management businesses to accelerate the use of Advanced Analytics & AI in understanding the voice of the customer – both what they say and how they interact with us.  With an eye towards creating personalized products and digital service experiences we will play a key role in the organizations commitment to be a digital, customer leader. 
 

What You Will Do

You will be at the center of where Advanced Analytics meets customer experience. As part of a team dedicated to Advanced Customer Analytics, you will help enable predictive servicing solutions, use Natural Language Processing techniques to understand the voice of the customer, experiment with journey analytics to resolve pain points in our online experiences.  You will support the research and development of a global customer analytics record - the foundation for all other work.

 
The Role Will Be Directly Responsible For

  • Supporting the creation of a global customer analytics record encompassing all elements of meaningful customer data, curated for Advanced Analytics & AI use cases

  • Identifying and investigate data for ingestion across all customer (and key B2B intermediary) experiences including sales, marketing, operations, web, mobile, call centers, and more.

  • Coordinating with global advanced analytics teams, business stakeholders, and technology teams to facilitate last mile delivery of reusable capabilities that can be easily deployed into new markets

  • Developing creative ways to source customer data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data using Big Data technologies

  • Providing thought leadership influences how data insights are delivered to the client throughout Manulife

Typical Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree with 3+ year’s experience, or Master’s with any of the following fields: Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Math, Engineering, Operation Research, Statistics, or other related quantitative fields.

Professional Experience may include

  • Understanding of modern data architecture, data science engineering, data modeling, data quality and manipulation of structured and unstructured data sources using state-of-the-art cloud computing technologies (Azure)

  • Experience delivering analytics & machine learning products, with a deep understanding of agile product delivery in an enterprise environment

  • Some familiarity with Big Data processing and building Data APIs. Experience with automated data quality frameworks is a plus.

  • Entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to creating rigorous, high-quality insights from data, at scale.

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to engage the enterprise across multiple specializations with analytically backed compelling stories

  • Prior experience with insurance or financial services is not required

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

item.title: AVP, Functions Advanced Analytics & Governance
item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

The AVP Functions Advanced Analytics & Governance (AVP – Functions AA & Governance) leads a group of teams in applying leading AI/AA technologies in support of Group Functions, governing AI/AA model risk and responsible AI framework, developing AI/AA R&D, while scaling up AI/AA training. AVP – Functions AA & Governance is a leader in managing AI/AA teams and a well-established professional within the AI/AA community; accountable for implementing Manulife’s AI/AA model risk framework and responsible AI framework; while also leading the AI/AA Academy for Executives and broader training initiatives; he/she is a connector who partners closely with CAO leadership in developing business plans in support of the corporate AI/AA Strategies.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Lead and inspire teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers by pushing the boundaries of AI/AA applications in support Manulife’s Group Functions. The levels of team members are from J (associate data scientist) to M (Lead Data Scientist)

  • Advises and influences Group Functions Executive leadership teams at different levels with leading AI/AA applications and trends, identifying new opportunities to develop solutions while tackling business problems

  • Lead the AI/AA model validation unit to implement the AI/AA Model Risk Framework. Develop Responsible AI framework

  • Lead global AI/AA R&D effort in bringing new methods and practices into Manulife and solving business problems

  • Lead the AI/AA Academy for Executives and broader training initiatives

  • Lead the engagement with academic research institutions and universities

  • Coordinate internal AI/AA knowledge sharing sessions, e.g. Monthly Best Practices, and research workshops with internal and external speakers on selected topics. Actively bridging the gap between the external leading research advances and internal practices

  • Actively engage with AI/AA communities and represent Manulife/John Hancock in AI/AA discussions externally

  • Consistently sees overall picture and alternative approaches; vision of what may be possible

  • Builds support and collaboration by communicating the significant impacts of a decision and sharing a vision of achieving the most favorable outcome

  • Maintains a strong internal network at all levels of the organization. Actively champions a diverse external network of industry/analytics thought leaders

  • Ability to attract outstanding talent to the organization

  • Influences AI/AA and business strategy by contributing ideas that solve meaningful business problems

  • Seen as a thought leader throughout the business. Actively listens to others and ensures all voices are heard

  • Actively seeks out coaching opportunities and incorporates feedback into their work

  • Provides guidance and mentorship to Directors and Data Scientists

  • Promotes best practices within the team, and shares technical expertise with others

  • Incorporates lessons learned throughout the business into their work

Key Shared Accountabilities:

  • Connect closely with executives in Group Functions and collaborate with business teams to develop project opportunities and deliver business solutions

  • Partner with CAO, Segment AI/AA leaderships and Enterprise Model Risk Management to develop and deliver AI/AA governance and training

Job Requirements:

  • Advanced degree in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Actuary or Engineering; PhD is preferred.

  • A track of record in leading AI/AA implementation or other analytical solutions in Finance, Risk or Compliance

  • Comprehensive understanding and experiences in model governance

  • Generally, a minimum of 10 years of applicable experience in quantitative analyses

  • A track of record of dynamic leadership experience in leading AI/AA teams

  • An established expert in AI/AA fields

  • Advanced knowledge of programming languages and concepts (e.g. Python, R or SAS)

  • Specialist in different techniques and knowledge of machine learning algorithms

  • Advanced knowledge of common database querying languages such as SQL; Capability of applying a detailed, structured approach to explore / navigate / mine massive amount of data, structured or un-structured, to uncover hidden patterns / insights

  • Strong ability to identify key Advanced Analytics opportunities in business and deliver results

  • Strong ability to initiate and carry research discussions with academic research communities, convey Manulife’s interest in research agenda and gaining knowledge and collaboration for Manulife’s business

  • Continuous learning

  • Actively monitor new technologies

Decision Authorities:

  • Define AI/AA for Functions strategy and plan according to the overall AI/AA Strategy and roadmap, and deliver results

  • Define responsibilities for teams under his/her supervision.

  • Hiring decisions for levels from J to M for both technical and managerial roles

  • Works on significant and unique challenges in AI/AA fields that hold strategic value to advance Manulife’s business

  • Strong ability to influence leaders and teams in both AI/AA function and business units

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed?  With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

The fast-growing Manulife Canadian Data office is hiring an associate data engineer working on advanced analytics engineering, Azure service, and AI/machine learning production in Toronto or Waterloo office

                                     

Job Summary

  • AI/Machine learning engineering and production

  • Big data application and analytics products

  • Advanced analytics and MLops solutions in the Big Data ecosystem

 Responsibilities for this role include:

  • Build AI/machine learning engineering and production, including recommendation engine and real-time decision management system

  • Lead multiple cross-functional teams to build big data application and analytics products leveraging cloud/bigdata/advanced analytics technologies to advance Manulife’s all lines of business

  • Participate in PoC/PoT efforts to integrate new Big Data management technologies, software engineering tools, and new patterns into existing structures

  • Exploratory data analysis; Query and process Big Data, provide reports, summarize and visualize the data

  • Research opportunities for data acquisition and new uses for existing data

  • Development of Big Data set processes for data modeling, mining and production

  • Consult, collaborate, and recommend solutions for batch and streaming use cases

  • Create and publish design documents, usage patterns, and cookbooks for technical community

Experience required for this role is as follows:

  • MUST have hands-on experience in python/Pyspark/SparkSQL/Scala/Java programming in Azure data lake, Hadoop, or AWS

  • MUST have experience with MLops/DevOps and infrastructure as code (such as Terraform)

Nice to have\'s:

  • Hands-on working experience in building recommendation engine and real-time decision management system

  • Certification of Azure data engineering or Azure solution architecture is a plus

  • Experience with data as service/API service/Microservice/Neo4j/Elasticsearch/NIFI/Sqoop

  • Experience in Big Data performance analysis, tuning and capacity planning

  • Show passion, take accountability, and be willing to grow and lead

What about Perks?

Manulife has lots of perks including, but not limited to:

  • Competitive compensation

  • Retirement Savings Accounts including a RPP (Pension Plan), RRSP (Retirement Savings Plan), and TFSA (Tax Free Savings account)

  • Manulife Share Ownership Program with employer matching

  • Customizable Benefits Package including Health, Dental, Vision, and 100% of Mental Health expenses

  • Financial support for ongoing training, learning, and education

  • Monthly Innovation Days (Hackathons)

  • Wearing jeans to work every day

  • An abundance of career paths and opportunities to advance

  • A flexible work environment with flex hours, work from home arrangements, distributed teams, and condensed work week arrangements.

This is a full time permanent role that can be worked from Toronto  or Waterloo, Ontario.
